Pre-Game Insights: The Clippers are 11-6 on their home court and eighth in the Western Conference with 15.6 fast break points per game led by Norman Powell averaging 4.6.
The Hawks have gone 8-10 away from home and are second in the Eastern Conference with 17.8 fast break points per game led by Jalen Johnson averaging 3.6.

The Clippers are shooting 46.5% from the field this season, 0.9 percentage points lower than the 47.4% the Hawks allow to opponents. The Hawks average 12.8 made 3-pointers per game this season, 0.1 more makes per game than the Clippers give up.
James Harden is averaging 21.9 points, 6.1 rebounds, 7.8 assists, and 1.5 steals for the Clippers.
Trae Young is averaging 22.3 points and 12 assists for the Hawks.
Others: The Clippers are 5-5 in their last 10 games, averaging 107.9 points, 41.0 rebounds, 22.8 assists, 10.4 steals, and 4.3 blocks per game while shooting 46.7% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 110.5 points per game.

The Hawks are 5-4 in their last 10 games, averaging 118.4 points, 44.8 rebounds, 29.0 assists, 10.6 steals, and 5.4 blocks per game while shooting 46.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 118.3 points per game.

Injuries: Clippers have Terance Mann (day to day - finger), James Harden (day to day - groin), Kawhi Leonard (day to day - knee), P.J. Tucker (out - personal). Hawks have Kobe Bufkin (out for season - shoulder), Larry Nance Jr. (out - hand), and Cody Zeller (day to day - personal).
